title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned if considers g''

1 point is earned for g''(x)=0 for all x

OR

1 point is earned for f is linear

1 point is earned for g is linear

g''(x) = f''(f(x)) * f'(x) * f'(x) + f'(f(x)) * f''(x)

If f''(x)=0 for all x, then

g''(x)=0 * f'(x) * f'(x) + f'(f(x)) * 0 = 0 for all x.

Thus, there is no x-value at which g''(x) changes sign, so the graph of g has no inflection points.

OR

If f''(x)=0 for all x, then f is linear, so g= f ∘ f is linear and the graph of g has no inflection points.
